name: Mini Crème de la Mer Moisturizer
about: What it is:An iconic, rich cream that thoroughly hydrates, visibly soothes redness and irritation, and is ideal for dry skin..Skin Type:Dry.Skincare Concerns:Dryness, Redness, Fine lines and wrinkles.Formulation:Rich Cream.Highlighted Ingredients:- Miracle Broth™: Helps create the perfect environment to calm the look of redness and other signs of irritation..What Else You Need to Know:Crème de la Mer is the original moisture miracle of La Mer's five moisturizers. Lines and wrinkles appear visibly repaired. Skin feels firmer, looks healthier, and appears visibly renewed. Miracle Broth™, the skin-loving elixir at the heart of every La Mer treatment, helps calm the look of redness and other signs of irritation.
ingredients: -Miracle Broth™: Helps create the perfect environment to calm the look of redness and other signs of irritation..-Lime Tea Concentrate: Contains antioxidants to protect skin from irritation due to environmental stressors..-Giant Sea Kelp: Support’s skin’s natural healing process...Algae (Seaweed) Extract, Mineral Oil\Paraffinum Liquidum\Huile Minerale, Petrolatum, Glycerin, Isohexadecane, Microcrystalline Wax\Cera Microcristallina\Cire Microcristalline, Lanolin Alcohol, Citrus Aurantifolia (Lime) Extract, Sesamum Indicum (Sesame) Seed Oil, Eucalyptus Globulus (Ecalyptus) Leaf Oil, Sesamum Indicum (Sesame) Seed Powder, Medicago Sativa (Alfalfa) Seed Powder, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seedcake, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Seed Meal, Sodium Gluconate, Potassium Gluconate, Copper Gluconate, Calcium Gluconate, Magnesium Gluconate, Zinc Gluconate, Magnesium Sulfate, Paraffin, Tocopheryl Succinate, Niacin, Water\Aqua\EAU, Beta-Carotene, Decyl Oleate, Aluminum Distearate, Octyldodecanol, Citric Acid, Cyanocobalamin, Magnesium Stearate, Panthenol, Limonene, Geraniol, Linalool, Hydroxycitronellal, Citronellol, Benzyl Salicylate, Citral, Sodium Benzoate, Alcohol Denat., Fragrance (Parfum)..Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Warm a small amount for a few seconds by smoothing it between the fingertips. .-Once translucent, gently press into face and neck, taking care not to massage. .-Apply day and evening...-For two healing hydrators, pair The Treatment Lotion (sold separately) with Crème de la Mer: First press on the Treatment Lotion, then warm a little Crème de la Mer and apply.

reviews.review_title: An excellent moisturizer for everyday use!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have used this moisturizer for many years and am very pleased with it! I use many la Mer products and love them all!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Loyal user for many years. No need to mention the cost in your reviews, fellow Sephorites-we all know it’s expensive. No need to mention the texture in your reviews, fellow Sephorites-if you read the product description, it clearly states the cream is dense and needs to be warmed up on your fingertips before using. Me? I use this nightly on top of my retinol and wake up with lovely, plump, moisturized skin. A must have for dry (maybe more mature) skin. Granted, it may not be for everyone but I won’t use anything else.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This product honestly upsets me by how amazing it is without having really any science to back Why it works. There is something magical in this jar though. I just bought the 1 ounce jar and it came shattered at the top of the jar. ￼ everywhere. I appreciate how amazing Sephora was. I had a replacement in the mail within hours.. definitely buy your high-end products from a place that will return them if and when they come completely shattered.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product is the biggest scam. The creme is way to heavy and it's poor quality. La Mer tells you to rub it between your fingers until it turns clear but it never does. They are just trying to trick you into wasting product on your hands. This company is owned by the Estee Lauder who has a history of false advertising and promotions. You can find a better creme at the drugstore where they will also treat you better than La Mer.

reviews.review_title: Cremedelamer may be for many, I ain't one of them
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been reading about La mer for more than a decade and I kept dreaming of when I will be able to afford it. Then the time came. I was only able to afford the mini though but I felt so excited nevertheless,  it was like a dream come true. I started with lamer soft cream, ( i had read some reviews about the original creme de la mer being too thick) and  yes within 1 week, I felt and saw the difference in my skin plump and glow, this healthy looking relaxed skin.I was bought! And ready to stick to the brand for life. But because it was the mini size, it didn't last me for more than 3 weeks. I decided to repurchase but this time, the original creme de la mer thinking because it is thicker, it will last longer. I was right on it lasting longer. But as per the effect on my skin-Horrible!!! To say the least. No matter how much I warm it up with my fingers as described and shown in the video,  this stuff won't get absorbed into my face skin. It just sits on my skin, with an ugly and sickly looking white cast like I am using a sunscreen or a foundation of lighter shade. Having read thousands of good reviews about this product,  I thought things will change with time plus considering the hard earned money i used to buy it.After about a week, my face started breaking out in an unusual manner. The break outs seem to be beneath my skin like with a veil...funny right. My skin became the dullest I have ever seen it. No radiance, no glow, just total dullness  that makes me sad when I look at my face in the mirror. I won't ever be buying creme de lamer again. Never. Maybe the soft cream in the future. Thank God I started with that. But I need to get over the waste of hard earned  money, the disappointment as well as the terribly DULL face. I have learned a lesson though. Reviews are not a reliable guide to choosing to buy a skin care product!  Thank you.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Look at the ingredients! Mineral oil, petroleum and fragrance. Yeah it's a no for me.

reviews.review_title: Glorified Vaseline Marketed as a Moisturizer
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I'm so glad I tried a sample before splurging on a full size! It felt like applying a thin layer of Vaseline to my face and did not get absorbed into my skin at all, the way I would expect a moisturizer to. I checked the ingredients list and lo and behold, the third most prevalent ingredient is petrolatum. After an hour, I started getting red bumps on my face. I can't believe this is so expensive and overhyped.

After feeling how thick and heavy this cream was I worried it wouldn’t be right for my skin. So far I’ve repurchased twice because of how smooth and glowy my skin has become.

reviews.review_title: It’s a necessity for my sensitive skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Yes it’s expensive-it works for me and I have decided it’s worth it. Yes, it has fragrance in it. It smells like old school rich lady cold cream. I don’t mind it and don’t get any irritation from it. In fact, I have broken out from a lot of‘fragrance-free’ products because often they mask the scent. Anyways-you MIST apply this the correct way! You warm it up on your hands and press it into your skin gently. Warming it up allows the algae spheres to disperse and work their ‘magic’. Pls be kind to this tried and true classic.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_text: It does everything it promises. My skin feels soft, looks plump, and extremely nourished. I simply can't live without it and has become a staple in my Anti-Aging care routine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: There are 9, yes, 9 different fragrances in the high-end cream! The likelihood of a breakout or irritation surpasses me at this price point. I always recommend getting on and researching the ingredients before you buy and apply. This cream has 2 ingredients that are in every single moisturizer made,  Vitamin B5 and Glycerin. If you want the name on your bathroom sink, find an empty container and fill it with a moisturizer that will actually strengthen your skin barrier.

reviews.review_title: I really wanted to hate this
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I got a sample in the rewards bazaar just to see what the hype is all about. It’s so overpriced (thus the deducted star) but I just couldn’t make myself hate it. I tried! It has worked wonders for my dry, sensitive skin. Within a week, my skin is glowy with no stinging sensations EVER. Not only that, my acne is getting better. Have my moisturizers been making it worse this entire time? I really don’t want to buy the full size, but I think I might have to. I cannot say goodbye to my new and improved skin.

reviews.review_title: I hate that I love it.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Ok.  Let me just start by saying I have fair sensitive skin and struggle with horrible dry patches on the sides of my face.   I’ve tried all sorts of things to control them, but really the only solution I’ve found is proper sleep, a good diet, a good gentle exfoliation, and staying on top of moisturizing.    I originally tried La Mer when I got a sample off the rewards bazaar.   It is crazy moisturizing, doesn’t sting my dry patches ever, and basically helps them to heal up.  I went years only getting the samples or buying the small jar and using it when my skin was at its worst.  Finally I’ve given up and use this as my everyday moisturizer.  I can buy a few less foundations or eye shadow palettes but good skin is a must.    I wish La Mer didn’t have fragrance and I really wish it wasn’t so crazy expensive.  I deducted a star for the price, because it’s totally insane.   I just haven’t found a cheaper alternative (yet) that works as well for my particular skin issues.   So there you are.  It’s a great product.   I love what it does for my skin.  But I hate the price.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this moisturizer for a couple of years now ( I tried both the soft cream and de la Mer M.).  I have very sensitive skin, and it works for me.  keeps my skin soft and hydrated.

I have combination skin as well and still get breakouts if I don't work extra hard. This didn't irritate a breakout that started but actually stopped it and calmed my skin (like woah!). My skin is so smooth and it feels SO good. This is thick and silky at the same time and just seeps right into my skin with a small amount. I wish it was cheaper (of course) but oh my gosh, it is awesome.

reviews.review_title: A comprehensive review of La Mer
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: First thing, it’s going to make your skin glow from the first use. It also adds notable clarity. It somewhat helps with acne and marks. You have to make sure you’re rubbing it between your hands and then patting it on to the face. You only need the smallest amount, just to cover your face- I use less than they advertise and less than I would use for my other creams. Any more is really too much, and you run the risk of greasiness, whiteheads, clogged pores and breakouts. I’ve been having major inflammation in my skin and after months of using it, it barely improved on these factors. I would really recommend using Drunk Elephant Wonderwild Miracle Butter- that stuff heals. This gives a luminous glow, a pricey one. It’s hard to rate this product without factoring in the exorbitant price. You really can find better or equivalent moisturizers for cheaper. So much of your skin is also due to lifestyle. I had to take off one star for the price which is hard to purely justify, and it also tends to enlarge your whiteheads. I took off another star because the ingredient list is also concerning- mineral oil, petrolatum and that it may give you breakouts. It does indeed smell like your grandmother’s cream. That being said, if nothing else works for you and this does, then it’s a small price to pay. Moreover if you really want a glow and can’t seem to get one, then this may be your product. I would really advise getting a sample or a trial size to try it out to make sure that your skin likes it before committing.

reviews.review_title: Makes skin look youthful and even toned

reviews.review_text: I recommend this product because when I used the free sample I noticed my deep pockmarks smooth out, it didn’t get rid of them but my skin looked even. I was hesitant to pay so much for this but I don’t regret it. I’m 40 years old and work the night shift and after using it for a month I’ve had so many of my coworkers tell me they thought I was in my early 20’s. And because of the night shift I tend to get dark circles under my eyes and I see an improvement there as well. I love this cream, and it is a generous amount that they give you.

reviews.review_title: Better absorption than the soft cream version!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have used the soft cream for yrs. La Mer has been my go to for when my skin acts up or is drier. But I always found the soft cream to sort of sit on top for awhile before being fully absorbed.  As I near 42 my skin just became very dry, so I gave the original a try. It is so much better than the soft cream!! You just have to warm up the paste like consistency. I put a small amt on my palm and warm it up then pat my face. It sinks right in compared to th soft reacm!

reviews.review_text: I have used Creme de la Mer Moisturizer off and on for 20 years.  It is my go to when I need to heal a sore on my face or on my arms or hands.  Wouldn't be without it.

reviews.review_title: Works if you use it correctly
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I don’t think those leaving reviews about how thick it is understand how it works and surely didn’t follow the instructions on how to use it. You’re supposed to take a small amount, using the spatula provided, and then warm it between your fingers until it’s translucent and then gently press into the skin. Yes it’s thick but if used properly, it’s not that thick on the skin. It’s extremely hydrating and only a small amount is needed to benefit from this product. I had a sample set of La Mer products and the week of use is what turned me on to them. I noticed the difference in my skin almost immediately. I’ve been using this for over a year and I get compliments on my skin frequently. I also get Botox, but I only get it 3x a year, my doctor recently commented on how great my skin looked and asked what I was using because he could tell a difference in my skin. While this is a very expensive product, it’s worth the investment, especially for those who already invest in their skin with Botox. And a little goes a long way. I can make a tiny jar last for months. Worth every penny in my opinion and I have used a lot of products over the years, inexpensive and expensive.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This company tests on animals, first and foremost. Why?! That aside, even, it’s overpriced and not even better in any way that any other facial moisturizer…at any price point. Don’t be suckered.

reviews.review_title: Overpriced garbage, made my skin so dry
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this as a deluxe sample with an order. For reference, I’m 40 and do not have dry skin. This stuff is awful. It’s super thick and difficult to spread across the face, and my skin has been SO DRY around my chin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample of this and was excited to use it but honestly I’m disappointed. For $200, the ingredients are questionable and it honestly didn’t do anything for my skin. It felt odd going on - kind of waxy - and didn’t feel very moisturizing. I don’t see what am the hype is about; just because something’s expensive doesn’t mean it’s good. Hard pass.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Can’t believe how expensive this cream is when the first ingredients are mineral oil—that’s baby oil ya’ll—liquid wax, and petrolatum—Vaseline. Basically, you’re putting products invented in 1870 and 1935 on your face. It sits on the skin. We’ve come so much farther than that when it comes to skincare. Just because it costs a lot of $$$ doesn’t mean it’s worth it. I received a deluxe sample.  Feels just like Nivea, except this smells like old lady in an old fusty room with doilies. Hard pass.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I cringed when I saw mineral oil as one of the first ingredients but tried it anyway, as expected, it sat on top of my face. Molecular structure of mineral oil is too big to ever absorb. Couldn’t wait to get my Drunk Elephant back on!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Some people say it's just basic ingredients but if you compare all moisturizers out there, the first ingredients is water. As you can see this one is sea kelp and water is at the bottom of the list. I really enjoy using this one cause I'm not paying for water as the main ingredient. Crème de la mer is so moisturizing but non greasy.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Helps my skin but steep price. I like it because you can feel how good it is.

reviews.review_title: Looked dry and cracked out of the box :(
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Upset that the product came looking cracked. Sephora has good customer service so the refund process was quick and easy, but it was still disappointing.

reviews.review_title: Heard it’s identical to Nivea—so I tested both
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I kept seeing people say that this cream is identical to the Nivea cream in the blue tin, so I decided to do a one-person blind trial of both. I scooped a teaspoon of each into identical containers, and had a friend label them “A” and “B” and write down which was which, to eliminate my own biases. I then used A on the left side of my face and B on the right each night for a week. Shockingly, they really are basically identical. They’re both decent occlusive night creams, but neither really did anything for me besides locking in whatever moisture my skin already had. I still had all the same issues with my skin that I normally do, except the La Mer side actually had some extra breakouts and redness that the Nivea side didn’t have. I didn’t expect miracles from La Mer, but I’m genuinely shocked that the $5 run of Nivea is not only the same, but BETTER.

reviews.review_title: Definite no - esp with the price !
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a free sample of this product and cannot understand why anyone would pay for it.  The consistency is so thick to the point that it’s hard to spread.  And I rarely break out - this cream has given me many whiteheads and pump

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I contemplated buying this for years because of the high price tag, but I finally bought it, and it's quickly become my most favorite moisturizer I have ever used! I have sensitive skin, and this moisturizes my skin like a dream, and it doesn't break me out!

reviews.review_title: Fragrance Too Strong and Skin Reacted
reviews.review_text: Absolutely Not! I received this product in the Sephora Favorites box. The fragrance is extremely strong, which is an automatic no. It smelled very similar to a perfume lotion. It is also a thick cream and very heavy. I noticed some clogging of the pores and finally quit using this product because of a reaction my skin had to it. Would not recommend.

reviews.review_title: Love it and im sorry to my bank account
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Honestly tried so hard to not like this based on price. My face is smooth, it blends well with my other skin serums and looks great under makeup. My skin is generally oily and I feel hydrated rather than slick. It's my fave moisturizer at a luxe level.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I refuse to use La Mer again. They reformulated the lip balm and I wouldn’t recommend it to my worst enemy. Same with the powder. I still like the moisturizer but too   expensive for what you get.

reviews.review_title: A never have in my routine
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Absolutely ridiculous price, for a cream that feels like $10 and works just like one. The only reason this cream might be this expensive is due to its packaging in which the cream lies. It’s a No!!!!! for me me      just want

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried a few La Mer products recently because everyone seems to love them, and now I'm convinced people are just fooling themselves to justify having paid an exorbitant cost.  This cream is...fine.  It is thicker and heavy and takes some work to spread it around.  It feels velvety but I don't think it feels super moisturizing.  I am happy to report that the fragrance in this isn't as powerful as some other La Mer products (looking at you, Treatment Lotion).  It doesn't really make my skin better or worse.  I wouldn't recommend this product, not because it's bad, per se, but because I feel like there are so many better products out there, none of which have such a high price tag.  I'm happy to pay for a good product, but this one is simply not worth it.

reviews.review_title: She’s expensive, but she’s a keeper.￼
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: So I had another accidental burn. This time it was on my face, and I decided to use this cream once again. In less than three weeks see the results for yourself.￼

reviews.review_title: High End? Yes. Worth it? No.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was pretty excited to see that Sephora was offering this cream and some other skincare products from La Mer as a part of their points/rewards program. I wanted to know what the hype about the ridiculously expensive skin care line was about.   What a disappointment. Let’s focus on just the moisturizer for this review - my eyes are watering from the strong scent it exudes and there is a slight tingly/burning sensation throughout my face (something I have never experienced with any other product before). The scent isn’t foul, but the thing about me is that I would much rather wear perfume on my décolletage than my face. The moisturizer applies very thin and feels almost powdery once dried down, yet remains hydrating. I mention this because I can at least confirm that the product is high quality - a little will go a long way and it won’t stay greasy or goopy on your face. However, everything else falls short.  Is it a nice moisturizer? Yes, I think overall it is. The burning, I presume, is from the heavy fragrance,  but isn’t unbearable, and the cream feels nice otherwise. Is it worth the pretentious price tag? Absolutely not, especially as other reviewers mentioned, the consideration that this cream has very basic ingredients. I think you could find an equally wonderful moisturizer for a fraction of the price, at a larger fluid size at that.  If you love this cream or want to splurge - please do so and live your best life! We should all enjoy in a little luxury now and again, whether it’s La Mer or Starbucks!

reviews.review_title: Excellent in all ways but the price
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: All day hydration, velvety soft texture! But, as much as it impressed me, I do think there are plenty of moisturizers of equal quality for half the cost.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: My go-to cream for the last 20 years. It is ultra hydrating. I have extremely sensitive skin which is why I am unable to use many products. I react to so many ingredients. I keep trying other less expensive creams but I always end up coming back to La Mer. It makes my skin feel supple and moisturized. It calms my skin when irritated. It helps that the jar lasts for a long time. A small amount goes a long way. I try to get it when there are offers or sale promotions. If you can afford it, I highly recommend it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I used to consider this product nice but overpriced until I realised I literally cannot find another face cream to replace it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: So something terrible happened. I accidentally burnt my right hand. I put this cream on it daily for about a week now and I’m amazed at the results…￼

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have repurchased this products 20 times in the past 2 years. It is very refreshing on the skin and has helped with my acne. I now have the clearest skin I have ever had and I really recommend it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Just got a sample of this to try and love it but the price seems a bit much!!

reviews.review_title: Good but not worth the price
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I probably won’t buy again. It is very thick but does not spread easily. I feel like I’m pulling my skin when I use it which is the opposite of what I want from a moisturizer. It is hydrating and my skin feels great post application.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Olive skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: 400$ for mineral oil and petroleum? definition of new money nonsense :')

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It is a bit dry to me, compared with this, I much more like the soft moisturizer cream.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using LaMer for several years.  I have to say, this is the ONLY skin cream I can use after I have any kind of chemical peel.  Every dermatologist formula skin cream, and many other moisturizers, I've used have left my face red and inflamed and this is cream does not.  it's absolutely amazing. Other reviews on other sites say LaMer is like Nivea, but it's not - my skin knows the difference - Nivea makes my face red, inflamed and itchy and LaMer does not.  I will never be without it!

reviews.review_title: Costs an arm and a leg but works wonders
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: There’s nothing that compares to this cream moisturizer. It actually has healing properties whereas other moisturizers just seem to sit on top of my skin. It costs an arm and leg thus four stars

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As much as I think Lamer moisturizer is outrageously expensive I keep going back to it. It does work better than any other moisturizer I have ever used.

reviews.review_title: Glad I only got a sample
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got this in the rewards bazaar, and honestly, it's the worst moisturizer I've ever used. It's heavily perfumed, and it burns. Don't waste your $.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Really don't see what the fuss is about. This was thick and moisturizing, but not any more than any other thick moisturizer. The effects didn't last any differently than any other. The price is WAY too high for what this is.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: La Mer gifted me a Moisturizing cream. As a person with dry skin, I am so happy that I found this moisturizer! It’s not only extremely hydrating but it also helps me with fine lines and wrinkles! I’m only 32 and it’s never to early to worry about wrinkles! Thanks la mer for sending me this gift!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brunette hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried so hard to find something else that worked just as well as this cream...and was not successful. I've tried SO many creams. None of them compare to La Mer's moisturizing cream. It's amazing. I wish it was less expensive, but it is worth the price. I think I will have to give up on finding anything similar, because I don't think it's out there.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This crème has transformed my skin. I glow! My skin is softer; dewy.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was recently gifted this moisturizer by La Mer and I have to say, I'm impressed! The formula is incredibly lightweight and absorbed easily into my skin, leaving no greasy residue or sticky feeling behind. Despite its lightweight texture, this moisturizer really packs a punch when it comes to hydration. My skin felt immediately soft and plump upon application, and after a week of use, I noticed a significant improvement in the overall moisture levels of my skin. I naturally have sensitive skin and this product did not break me out and it also helped with my redness. Overall, I highly recommend this lightweight soft cream moisturizer for anyone in need of a hydrating and non-greasy formula that's perfect for daily use. Gifted by La Mer or not, It’s definitely a staple if you love skincare.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is worth the hype! love how smooth it leaves my skin and it feels so glowy afterwards. ive never used a cream that has made my skin feel like this. although this was gifted by la mer its definitely worth the investment!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have no clue why this product has some great reviews, too thick , hard to apply, I removed it from my skin right away. Don't buy it!

reviews.review_title: AWESOME Cream! READ THIS BEFORE PURCHASING!!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: You guys can say, It's too overpriced, or, The ingredients are too basic, but I would say this product, despite its price, is actually pretty good. A few reasons why are because it works on my sensitive skin, it's really moisturising, and it's perfect for under your makeup. Starting with the first reason, which I thought was very impressive. Usually when there is fragrance in these types of products, it's not a great match for my sensitive skin but this moisturiser works so well. It has a light-weight, luxury, and moisturising feeling that no other cream could give me. I also found it to soak into my skin really easily and it looks SO good under my makeup! When I have a full face on, I usually wear the Armani Foundation, Nars Concealer, Hourglass Powder, Westman Atelier Contour Stick, Charlotte Tilbury Bronzer Powder, Charlotte Tilbury Highlighter, Nars Powder Blush, Tom Ford Eyeshadow, Lancome Volumizing Mascara, Tom Ford Brow Sculptor, and Charlotte Tilbury Airbrush Flawless Setting Spray. IT ALWAYS LOOKS PERFECT. GET IT IF YOU FEEL LIKE SPENDING MONEY ON A LUXURY SKINCARE ITEM BECAUSE THIS ONE IS SO GOOD!! You will definitely see changes in your skin, good ones. (Overall, great cream for all skin types, cute packaging, little goes a long way, and light-weight/luxury feeling on skin.)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I like this for its moisturizing potential. AND, I think there are other products (particularly Laneige’s cica night mask) that give me more bang for my buck. So, it’s not that this is bad, but I don’t think it’s amazing value for money.

reviews.review_title: Best night cream for sensitive skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Bought this as a last resort after trying so many cream to sooth my aching/burning face. Really didn't want this to be the winner, but there wasn't even a close second. I use this at night everyday and my skin looks so much younger, smoother and even toned. Finished it and tried to go without .. didn't last more than a couple of weeks as my skin began to do worse and have irritation and blemished again. This is a must

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: How can they sell this cream at this price point?? It's a total non-sense for me, as it's not very good. The 2nd ingredients is mineral oil, it's very deceiving. I think it's exactly the same product than the Nivea rich cream, the blue pot they sell 10$ for 150 ml. Look at the ingredient list, it's similar (mineral oil, microcristalline wax and glycerin).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample of this product as a gift and I’m obsessed. This product is truly miraculous. It is really light weight on the skin and doesn’t feel oily at all. It has transformative powers for your skin and actually works which makes it worth it. It smoothed texture on my forehead where I was having sensitivity and makes my skin feel hydrated and less dull. I would definitely look to get more of this cream!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is absolutely an indulgence and if I had the money I would buy the larger size! For me, this definitely delivers and is the best moisturizer I have ever used. My skin looks and feels wonderful after using. I use it for wrinkles and overall moisture and it certainly delivers. I have somewhat sensitive skin and this does not irritate my skin at all. I love the smell of it--very clean and very subtle to my nose. I prefer this over the soft moisturizer because a little of it goes a long way. It's a bit thicker and the consistency reminds me of the Nivea hand/overall cream vs a liquid-like moisturizer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love la mer so this was definitely a treat. it feels so luxurious and the jars are so cute. This is definitely a special occasion product for me but one I look forward to using everytime. It also looks great under make up.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I had really high hopes for this product because of the price tag but I am pretty dissatisfied. It’s very hard to apply & you could honestly get the same results from using Nivea. Wouldn’t repurchase

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I recently started using tretinoin in my routine, and my combination skin became super dry as a result of it. Nothing would touch the flaky patches around my nose and temples until now! Yes, this product is expensive, and yes, it is thick - but if used as directed (ie warm it up between your fingertips first, and then pat it in), it is a lifesaver for dry skin. Additionally, fragrance usually irritates my sensitive skin, but this one doesn't. Honestly, don't knock it till you try it. I'm a La Mer believer now!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: As an aesthetician, using a spray toner (alcohol free), each time before applying this product correctly will make a huge difference. It allows you to not overuse the cream and it also prevents it from sitting on top of your epidermis and making your skin feel greasy and uneven.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: who in their right mind decided to make this $745? who would buy this

reviews.review_buyer_description: black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried a mini sample  and I absolutely loved it felt so soft but this one I purchased was so thick it felt like Nivea but with a higher price tag. Not sure why the sample formula is different :/ disappointed

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: My favorite moisturizer splurge. Seriously the best for winter time

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately it was not as great as all the reviews I’d read! It does have fragrance which is a deal breaker for me. It caused acne for me. Considering the high price, I’d definitely recommend other moisturizers out there.

reviews.review_title: A must have in my routine!
reviews.review_text: I live in the desert and need moisture. At first I thought it would be too much moisture because of how it feels on your fingers. But if you allow the creme to warm up on your fingers before applying then it will feel great when applied. It is the right amount for people who are older with dry skin.

this cream is way too thick, first time i applied it it was just a blob on my face i literally could not smooth it around my face. i'm convinced anyone who says this cream is good is just lying to themelves.

This works like a standard moisturizing cream; I can't say anything in the formula stood out to me as being worth the price. I don't have anything negative to say, since it does its job. However, if you're on the fence, I'd go with the smallest size instead to try it out before committing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product, first time buying it. For the 15ml if you use it properly as they say it will last about three months of using it every night which I do. My skin glows what more can I say, if you can afford this or you’re willing to spend the money then you should.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: U know seeing this price is funny. It simple moister cream, u can find something like that every at a price of like 30$. It even doesn't make ur skin enough moisture 🤦🏼‍♀️

reviews.review_title: Today I learned to follow the instructions!!
reviews.review_text: My mom got this as a gift a year ago and ran out so I bought her a refill for Christmas...yes, my wallet hurt a bit but it's nice to splurge on my mom. I've tried the Sephora sample before and liked it okay but didn't think it was spectacular BUT!! The salesgirl helping me today told me I was USING IT WRONG and I was like, I don't know how to apply face cream?? Apparently you're never supposed to spread la mer products on your face! I got another sample and immediately tried it using the proper method of warming between fingers and then patting on face. Wowwwww so much nicer experience and yes, I came to write this review just to share what I learned today. Sticker shock remains unchanged but I read all the reviews online and sure enough, many of the 1-2 stars reviews are complaining about the spreadability and even under instructions it says PRESS INTO FACE, DO NOT MASSAGE. I feel like it should be more prominently labeled but I guess it wouldn't make for very aesthetic packaging. If you're reading this, I hope this helps!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is really over priced, I got the trail size set with my points that came this cream, plus the la mer renewal oil. The cream on its own is not sufficient for a moisturizer it is a weird, thicker texture that does not spread well, even on wet skin. You absolutely need to use it with the oil. You can have the same or better results with a simple moisturizer on its own or with an oil like argon oil. I would not buy this product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Agree with other reviewers that this is way overpriced and over hyped. It’s a waxy balm for your face almost like sometning you wear to prevent windburn. I got the miniature sizes with my points and was so excited but it’s just a crappy product my points

reviews.review_title: Hope I can use it before it expires
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Used it over a year and I really wanted to love it…but I don’t…Too inconvenient to apply it..It’s very thick and you have to rub it between fingertips prior to applying it.. I have been forcing myself to use the product since I spent so much money and it has been such a chores…I’m really hoping to use it up before it expires. I really don’t think this product is worth the hype and cost.  Will not be buying it again

reviews.review_title: Not worth the hype. Not even a little.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Definitely not worth the hype in my opinion. I’ve read about this moisturizer since I was a kid and never wanted to pony up the cash for it. I finally decided to and …. Was not impressed. It seems to be a sufficient thick moisturizer maybe for winter before bed…. But not life changing or even that impressive at all. It’s hard to get all over my face too, like so thick it’s hard to spread. It doesn’t smell particularly good either. Really unclear as to why this is such a cult fave. I get the price tag as for its manufacturing process but why the trouble for such an average lotion????

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Yes, I know it’s expensive. Yes, I know people will say the ingredient deck isn’t that special. But, there’s no dupe for this product. And I’ve been using it at night for MANY years. I can’t live without it. It’s super moisturizing, and when used correctly, you are basically slugging with a very small amount of product. You wake up to fabulous skin. It’s especially great to use after Tretenoin if you’re using that.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Worth every penny! I have been using La Mer since I was 18.  Every so often I will get a sample and like the smell or texture and try it.  Nothing compares to La Crème de la Mer.  A little goes a long way so it lasts a long time!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, auburn hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: it goes onto the skin very well, but it's definitely not worth the price tag.

reviews.review_title: Still on the fence after 3 years…
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Using x3 yrs now. It goes on thick, definitely hydrating. No dramatic changes as far as lifting/firming/fine-line reducing. However, my skin has not worsened, so maybe it’s maintaining it?

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this moisturizer, by far the best one I’ve used. Smells so nice and leaves skin feeling fantastic. You don’t need to use much. Only downside is the price but definitely worth it.
This cream completely changed my skin overnight!! It’s my third time purchasing it. Highly recommend

reviews.review_title: DO NOT BUY SMELLS LIKE OLD PERFUME BOTTLE
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: If I could give zero star I would. It smells like old bad perfume, just gross. It came as a duet set special and I wonder why do a duet of the same product one small and one regular size, and not different duo products which would have been a better choice. I didn’t touch the product so I will return it. Very disappointing when you think about the cost and the praise we here about La mer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I use the La Mer Soft Cream now. However, this is my winter cream. It is super thick. I love it. If you have oily skin, I would not recommend. This is for us dry skin baddies. And No, Nivea doesn’t come close to this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I want ti give it a 5 but it’s expensive. However expensive, my skin just cannot survive without it esp during the winter months. This is my holy grail moisturizer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been using this moisturizer for three years and it is hands down the best in the game. I have dry skin and with this, a little goes a long way! Although it’s pricey, it’s my holy grail and it lasts for a long time, just be sure to use the spatula provided and follow the instructions

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I wish it didn’t work so well because I can’t afford to buy this regularly. Lol. At first I was very skeptical. The cream is definitely on the thick side and the application process takes some getting used to. I did not see results during the first two weeks but after that, it’s a game-changer. My 5 ML sample lasted me a little more than a month - a little goes a long way! My skin feels smooth and slowly, I and other people have noticed my dark spots fade away. Just the past two weeks, two different have commented on how good my skin looked and couldn’t believe that I wasn’t wearing any makeup. However, it is overpriced in my opinion and consistency is key. So if you don’t have the budget for this, you won’t really see lasting results. I just bought the $100 mini jar after my sample ran out which should last me 3 months at least. That’s the good news - you don’t need to use a lot of product.  TL:DR - It works when used consistently. Overpriced but a little goes a long way. Worth it if money is not an issue.

reviews.review_title: dried me out in the morning
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve always wanted to try their product. I finally decided to use their sample set that I received for rouge. The cream is very thick and it does feel very moisturizing so I was very hopeful. Much time my surprise the next day my face felt and looked so dry that I had to put moisturizer on just to do my morning routine before I got ready for my day.  Very disappointing. Glad I got to try it out before I made the purchase.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Debating whether I should give this 1 star or 2 stars …. Crème de la mer  is definitely hydrating and moisturizing , but only 30 min to 1hr after application . I apply crème de la mer in the evenings , and the next morning, my skin feels extremely dry and tight , to the point where I need to apply aquaphor all over my face . I believe the fragrance is to blame . This crème is very thick , so if you are not too dry , this might not be the one for you . Felt very waxy and very hard to spread. Oh and by the way , this smells exactly like cetaphil face wash (not a good thing , I hate that smell !) But hey , if you have the money to spend $200 only for 1 oz , go ahead ! Tryit yourself . I have dry acne prone skin and this product was horrible ! Yuck

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Got my hands on a small pot of Creme de la mer that was good for maybe 5 applications and decided to give it a try, after all there had to be some reason this was recommended so highly to me, right? Unfortunately, just as I expected from a product that lists 'mineral oil' so high up in the ingredients list, and a potentially irritating 'Eucalyptus Oil' on the list too, I broke out literally on day 2. The only positive was that it did slightly clear up a dry patch on my right cheek but to be fair I could have achieved that with anything on my dressing table. It sat like an oily film for hours on my face and its a testament to my patience how I didn't grab the nearest washcloth to remove it with! Gave this to my mum to try (dry/normal skin type) seeing as I still had a bit left in the pot and her feedback was merely an it's ok, nothing special. If you have dry skin or suffer from dehydration and are NOT sensitive then by all means give it a try. From an ingredients perspective however there is nothing 'advanced' about this formulation. Antioxidants, yes, but don't expect the jar packaging to keep them stable, despite the addition of Kathon CG, normally found in rinse-off products, not ones that are supposed to be absorbed by the skin!   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. Hair Loss Treatment: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Hair Oil  2. Shampoo: 'Sephora Collection' - Deep Cleaning Shampoo 3. Face Mask: ‘Peter Thomas Roth’ – Pumpkin Enzyme Mask  4. Pigmentation + Anti-Aging Serum: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Facial Treatment Serum 5. Face Scrub: ‘Sisley' - Botanical Gentle Buffing Cream 6. Lip Balm: ‘Nuxe’ – Reve De Miel Lip Balm 7. Lip Liner: ‘Sephora Collection' - Rouge Gel Lip Liner

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: You have to use it for very day for about 3 weeks to a month, then you will see results!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It is extremely thick, smells like my grandmas pink lotion, didn’t notice a difference in my skin and my skin is extremely dry.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Yes it’s expensive, but if you have dry skin this is a game changer. Every time I use this at night I wake up with hydrated, plump and dewy skin. My makeup the next day goes on perfectly. Does not break me out. I’ve tried MANY moisturizers and always come back to this one. Does have a luxurious smell, so if you don’t like scents I wouldn’t get. I personally love the smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This crème is a game changer. I know it’s expensive but so worth it. I have definitely noticed a difference in my skin’s texture. It is softer and feels great all day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I thought about buying this for a while and went into a store to see if the smell was really strong and I hated the smell at first from the store display. But I was still thinking about it so o bought it. The new jar I received did not smell bad at all! I follow directions to apply it by patting it in and it does feel heavy but I use it only at night so I really don’t mind it. I feel like it restores my skin if it’s hurting. I’m going to keep buying it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I got this as a sample and I’m very glad I did. It’s super greasy and feels so gross. I had to wipe it off. And I have pretty dry skin, everywhere. And I just can’t with this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this product.. For the first time saw a difference and my skin feels good. Expensive but worth it, Only a face lift could get 5 stars, but this feels good.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It’s been a long time since I’ve used this amazing product. But I’m now 50, my skin has been looking a little fatigued and all the exfoliating and Tatcha products aren’t cutting it (love Tatcha!) i got a raise and thought, I’m doing this, lets see if it’s a reset. I just washed and applied a pea sized serving of this miracle to my face and neck and also my eyelids which have been flaky and irritated due to allergies. BOOM: irritation gone, hydrated and dewey, feeling amazing. It’s expensive, yes, but dayum…i missed yhis!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I always get excited when I see a trial version being offered. One day I’ll buy it, but for now I’ll settle with stretching out the sample. It’s hands down the best moisturizer I’ve ever used and nothing compares to it. My skin tone evens out, and feels soft and plump.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not worth the price at all. This did nothing for me that a standard moisturize could not.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received a trial of the La Mer moisturizing cream. At first I was so excited to try this because a lot of reviews said it is great for dry skin and rosacea. I'm giving this one star due to the extremely strong bad smell and my face felt drier after I put it on. The moisturizer was thick, as described in the other reviews and I felt it was hard use. Just disappointing that it is not what I thought. The worst part I can not get past is the smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So sad about this cream. When I got the chance to finally try it, I broke out like crazy. I kept it up hoping it would subside and it only got worse. I guess I should be glad that this doesn’t work for me since the price is outrageous.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I honestly did not want to fall in love w this product because of the price but… truth be told, I fell in deep. This moisturizer has been such a game-changer to my skincare routine. There was a significant change with the texture of my skin and my pores shrunk with first couple uses. Plus, the packaging and the product is definitely of luxe quality. Now, I just need to wrap my head around the price tag.

reviews.review_title: A favorite treat for my dry skin.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is a favorite moisturizer for my dry skin, and one of a rare few that leave my face feeling moisturized all day. Initially I didn’t love it because I thought it was thick and pasty. A couple of tips turned this cream into a silky, luxurious product for me, however.  One, it helps to warm up the cream in your hands first—this allows for greater spreadability. Second, applying on slightly damp skin (in addition to the above step) helps the cream melt into the skin even better. I personally like to use this as an overnight mask and the last step in my evening routine as it’s very occlusive.   Do I see a reduction in fine lines or any other such drastic changes with the Crème de la Mer?  No, I do not, but it’s a fantastic moisturizer and when my skin is hydrated it looks more youthful. It’s not a must buy but it’s a lovely treat for me when my budget allows it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: More like a sticky paste than cream. I also do not like the way it smells.

reviews.review_title: Heaven for glowy normal to combo skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was NOT expecting to love this moisturizer as much as I do. I received Creme de la Mer as a special holiday gift from my parents, since they know my skincare tastes are typically more budget friendly. I have normal to combo skin with the occasional breakout, but I love a glowy, moisturized base.   Even though I will feel the pain of repurchasing it, I'm going to do it because my skin has never looked more glowy and healthy than when I use this creme. If you do choose to purchase this creme, PLEASE read the directions! This is a really thick creme that needs to be activated in your fingertips before applying. Once you activate the creme, it literally melts into your skin, giving you a fantastic glow.   I'm only giving this product 4/5 stars just because the price is absolutely ridiculous... even though I'm going to pay it because of the results!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It’s moisturizing and definitely feels very luxurious, but the texture is strange in that it sits on my dry skin in some areas and looks almost flaky? Its not bad but it definitely can look a little patchy, even when I rub it between my finger tips to “activate” the extracts. Overall It’s a nice cream and does make my skin glow but honestly if you want to try it but don’t want to spend the ridiculously overpriced amount for it, just get some German Nivea moisturizing cream and put a few drops of The Ordinary’s Marine Hyaluronics in it. The exact same thing, but actually better because the Marine Hyaluronics has a bigger variety of algae in it. Plus it sinks in the skin much better!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this for years 1 ounce last me a year because I put an intense oil on it first that way it just glides on your face very smoothly take a dab put it between both hands on the finger tips rub it so it warms it up and then place it on your face.  And enjoy the benefits because the stuff is a miracle in a bottle.  This review is in response to the person that said the stuff is too heavy to go on her face and this is how you get it to work and enjoy all the benefits.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really don’t get the hype. I got a mini size of this in a Sephora favorites kit and it’s lasted me for over a month so far with about a week or so of use left. The cream is extremely rich and does not spread on the skin easily. Thankfully, it doesn’t leave a greasy feel. There’s nothing super wrong with it, but there’s also nothing that feels all that special. For the price, you’d expect to wake up with brand new looking skin and it just doesn’t do that for me. I have felt a significant difference even overnight from much more affordable moisturizers like the Tatcha dewy skin cream. Also, this smells exactly like Nivea cream, which is just ??? I would never spend any amount of money on this. Use a good retinol and a night cream with ceramides and peptides—it’ll do far more for your skin for FAR less money.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have to say, I really wanted to hate this. I wanted to join all the skincare communities and say, “this is over priced and isn’t any better than Nivea or Cera Ve”, but that just ISN’T TRUE. I’ve used Nivea, it does NOT moisturize my desert dry skin anywhere close to this cream.  Of course, I still have to do my skincare routine, but my usual night time moisturizer wasn’t cutting it this winter in Toronto, and I used my Rouge Reward on this and have zero regrets. The best part is you need so little! I only use 1/8 of a my finger nail amount and it covers my whole face and neck! I mix in The Ordinary’s a 1/4 spoon niacinamide powder for an extra boost which works out great for me!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Been using this cream for over 30 years.  Best on the market...forget the cost.  I’m 74 and my skin looks like in my 50s.  So glad Sephora carries this!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This cream may be a miracle for some people, but it was definitely not for me. I used it for over 2 months. I have had the worst breakouts that I have had since I was a teenager. The “anti-aging” effects were minimal. It smells like a drugstore lotion (not awful just not amazing). On a positive note, the small jar did last a long time. I was only half way through it when I stopped  using it. Please save your money.

reviews.review_title: save your money! not worth it
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was expecting a lot from this moisturizer factoring the price and the reputation of the company. Happy I got the small jar in Sephora favorites but after trying it didn’t find anything special about it. Very thick cream reminds of old blue Nivea cream with same smell and consistency. It is greasy and very hard to apply. It does moisturize like any other moisturizer but does nothing else.

reviews.review_title: Ok, not great and not amazing.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I used this for a period and loved it. But honestly I feel like this product is mostly about the branding. I dont see how this moisturizer is that great. Its not bad. I think the secret is the way they instruct you to apply it, which is very good for the skin (patting it on, rather than pulling the skin). But honestly I think so much of this is overhyped and due to branding. It is very nourishing which I like and has no silicones. But for the price is it not a miracle. its not going to transform your skin, get rid of dark spots, acne scars, or reverse aging. If you're looking for a very nourishing product and have a lot of money then this could be fine. But if you have scared  skin, or want something that makes your skin look amazing in the morning try something much more nourishing for cheaper.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product hands down is the best!  I used this in my 20's, at that time I really did not need it, it's very rich and moisturizing cream.  I purchased it again about a month ago, tried so many different night creams that did not help.  I have combo skin and it's very sensitive this is the best, when I wake up my skin is so soft, no redness, I also have rosacea.  I sleep on my side and always woke up creases around that eye, no longer have that!  It's expensive but I've spent so much on others that did not help.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample and was excited to try such a expensive supposedly luxury moisturizer but it’s horrible, glue consistency grandma perfume, so oily and heavy on the face.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: love this cream for the colder months or for a night cream throughout the year. I have oily/combo skin and luckily, good skin to begin with so I didn’t experience any transformational effects with this cream. that said, my skin felt extremely nourished, hydrated, and healthy when applying this cream. personally I don’t love the whole application process where you need to rub between your fingertips and pat in as I have light facial hair - but it’s something I was able to get a hang of over time!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Miracle product! I think a lot of people aren’t reading the directions or using correctly. It smells heavenly, a lux, thick creme. Glowing, plump skin and it’s only been a month. Obsessed. I’ll never use anything else at night. Just ordered the body lotion & some serums! There’s a reason this stuff has a cult following.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: After reading multiple reviews about Nivea being a dupe, I felt like I needed to add my two cents.  I received this as part of a Luxe Sample set from Sephora. To say I am obsessed may be an understatement. My skin is normal to oily. I use a very small amount on my face after a dry oil based serum. I always warm it on my hands before use.  If you use too much, you won't be happy. This product is not meant to be used in excess nor is it necessarily. It has a lovely light fragrance. It leaves my face extraordinarily soft. I received the most lovely compliment a week after using.  I am nearing 44, and I was told someone really liked how I did my makeup. Thing is, I was not wearing makeup. I simply moisturized.  If you use this product in miniscule amounts, that 1 oz will last as long as many of your other mid-priced moisturizers, but with tremendous results.  I highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: it’s okay but not worth the money
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The second I grabbed some of it and had it on my hands I was getting nivea cream vibes. Kinda smells like it to me to. It does leave ur skin feeling healthy, glowy and fresh…. But for the price tag, absolutely not worth it. U can find so many dupes. I got it as a sample and will be finishing it but will not purchase. Save ur coins!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Worth every dollar! I used this in my early 20’s when I didn’t really need it. Now at 39 its been a lifesaver.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: some what disappointing for the price. I thought I would indulge and when I got it, it was an odd texture and didn't go over the skin easily. After a week plus of use really didn't notice much difference and for that price,  had hoped for more.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: watch you skin transform, little goes a long way, used at night only

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: One of my favorites I have been using for over 25 years. But it is a heavy cream

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve heard about la mer for years and I would never buy it because of its price. I thought it would be a miracle worker according to all the hype about it. I got a trial size and was very excited to try. Turns out it’s meh. Nothing special about it. I find that I have to use quite a bit to even feel it on my skin. It does not irritate my sensitive skin, which is a plus. Once I get a sufficient amount on, it’s okay. I wouldn’t pay full price for it though.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received a free sample with an order. This stuff smells SO bad! It’s absolutely intolerable. Glad I didn’t pay. I’ve literally never smelled a beauty product so awful. The texture and color seemed fine so I don’t think I received a bad batch.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I LOVE the original creme de lar mer , the first ingredient that you see is seaweed not water. This leaves the skin like butter , I've been using it for years , have tried other stuff that is good but this is magnitudes better .

reviews.review_title: Save your money. Definitely not worth the price.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I do not understand the overwhelming positive reviews of this highly overpriced moisturizer. The scent is off putting and reminds me of cheap brand moisturizers you could get at Target. It’s also a bit on the greasy side. There is absolutely nothing special about it. I received this as a gift and feel bad so much money was spent on such a sub-par (for its price) product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love la mer.  Have been using it nightly for 20 years

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Sadly. I received a sample of this at my local Sephora. I didn’t notice much after a single use, but on my second try it truly made my skin look plumper and healthy and youthful. Wow. An amazing product but I am hesitant to make a big purchase since a little did not go a long way for me. I had to use a generous amount to see the results - but they are very good results. That said. I’m certain there’s a cheaper alternative that can do wonders. I haven’t found it yet though!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really don’t know why it’s so expensive and does so little. My CeraVe moisturizer costs $8 and is much more effective.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been using this cream on and off for many years. It’s unique and I don’t have another face moisturizer like it. I recommend this for anti-aging/ dry skin/irritation. This cream heals my redness or any red irritation that needs to heal on my face. It does not break me out or cause any issues. No strong scent. I enjoy the experience of prepping my skin and applying this after my tretinoin. My skin is glass like in the morning. I also enjoy the Lamer soft cream formula as well. I do not prefer one over the other. They both moisturize equally. These are expensive products and they are not for everyone. I don’t recommend this cream if you’re already angry about the price. These are great products if you give them the opportunity to work.

reviews.review_title: Can be your best friend if you let it!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: So I remember one of my nieces coming up to me and asking me if she could ask a personal question.  Had I had anything done to my face!  She meant plastic surgery.  I nearly fell over.  The only thing I had done to my face was Creme De La Mer.  That was quite a few years ago but I never forgot it.  I allowed money to become an issue (it is expensive) but recently went back to La Mer.  And I can see the difference already.  For me there can be nothing else.  Yes, some always remains on my fingers, but I always find somewhere else to apply it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I really want to say I don't like it to save my pocket the pain... But, my skin won't lie... It loves it! I actually tried this creme a few years back (in my 20s), my skin hated it then and it disapproved it by protesting with a bunch of milia and tiny pimples. The moment I hit my big 3, my skin decided to act wild (extra sensitive in forms of flame ups and pimples) and I tried various products, but this was the only thing that calmed it down. Yes, after a few years my skin decided it likes miracle broth, wasted my money back then. What a grumpy and demanding child! I started with a mini emulsion and creme (gifts from La Mer), then I ran to grab the full size emulsion and creme... And because my skin loved it so much, I bought the creme duet set and another full size emulsion just to make sure I have backups.  The creme feels similar to Nivea cream, but it's not the same... I tried to get my skin to like Nivea but it simply didn't like it and didn't calm anything down, it's a great moisturizer for the body though. The smell of Creme de La Mer is more elegant than the smell of Nivea Cream. Someone said rotten seaweed, perhaps they got a bad batch? I love the smell, a very calming sensorial flight for me every time I use it (AM and PM, and sometimes mid day if I go out and decide to wash my face mid day). I use two pumps of emulsion then follow up with a pearl size of creme warmed up between my finger tips and patted on. My skin calmed, smoothed, lifting, and firmed; and my skin haven't glow like this since my teens. Will keep repurchasing until my skin decides it likes another product! The price isn't bad, you only need a pearl size each time, a 7mL lasts me 2wks and 15mL 4wks with me using it almost 3 times every day. I bought the creme duet which is a 60mL + 15mL and that should last me a while. If you buy a 60mL (4mths about) at CAD$470, it's about CAD $4/day, that's less than the price of a cup of Starbucks each day!

I’m not sure what the hype is around this moisturizer. The hefty price tag doesn’t justify the so called benefits achieved from this moisturizer. It’s very thick and dries very quickly. I would say other moisturizers around the $40+ range work just as well.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I would sell my left arm to afford another tub of this stuff when I run out. I bought the mini to see how I like it because my acne-prone, combination skin was constantly breaking out and getting dry. This has cleared up my acne and helped with fine lines on my forehead and near my eyes. I just put the 1 oz tub in my cart. I hope my skin never gets used to this cream because it’s not fair to deal with wrinkles and acne at the same time. I’ve already suffered enough. Seriously, people. I’ve tried everything and this is my holy grail product. Also, I love the smell and I don’t know what people are complaining about.

reviews.review_title: It feels like glue and smells bad - don't bother!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my first time trying La Mer. I used this with their Hydrating Infused Emulsion and after using both products morning + night for two weeks I now have several deep blemishes. The texture is sort of glue-like, I don't really like how thick it is despite usually enjoying a thick cream style moisturizer and the scent is awful. I followed the instructions and warmed it between my fingers but it didn't feel any better than a $60 moisturizer. I would not recommend purchasing.

reviews.review_title: It's a definite MUST HAVE for me!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I honestly am looking through the low ratings and my mind is blown.  I have NEVER a skincare product more important to my skin healing than Creme De La Mer.  Expensive?  Yes.  Worth it?  A hundred fold.  I have EXTRWMELY sensitive skin with eczema and I can honestly tell you that this has SAVED MY SKIN.  On a very rare occasion I don't get to my eczema quick enough and then it's my prescription is reach for.  But if I could do a PR for these guys, I'd be thrilled. I can tell you this is the most I've been without makeup in forever.  I am finally comfortable in my own skin.  I won't be without.

reviews.review_title: Just because its expensive, doesnt mean its good
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to like this product…I mean I reallyyyyy wanted to considering the price tag, but this moisturizer just did not do it for me. Working it in the skin is a struggle, even after rubbing it between your fingers first. It goes on like legit drywall putty. Its very thick and sits on top of the skin (not in a good way), and to be honest, feels like a face mask i should be washing off. The smell isnt terrible to me, but I could see how its not for everyone. I will be sticking with my Confidence in a Cream by IT Cosmetics!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: FIRST - You MUST rub the crème between your fingers to “release the Miracle Broth” before applying. You end up wasting a lot of product on the tips of your fingers. SECOND - It STINKS! Smells like rotten seaweed. And it lingers. THIRD - It’s GREASY. Doesn’t absorb well. My skin looked greasy all day. FOURTH - NOT hydrating! You’d think with all the oil it would at least provide my dry skin with moisture. After the first week, I had to add my PTR hyaluronic acid serum first to get the hydration my skin needed. FIFTH - Stopped using this after two weeks because my skin was getting RED SPOT breakouts. Good thing I used my Sephora points for this!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Go buy yourself a nice meal instead. This is overpriced and underperforming.

reviews.review_title: La Mer is truly a MER-acle!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I stopped using this cream once and I'll never stop again.
